channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Instagram’s TV app is launching on Google TV devices
item.description: By bringing Reels to TVs, Instagram looking to better compete with YouTube, which largely dominates the TV space.

item.title: NASA’s Curiosity Finds Crunchy Nodules Where Ancient Martian Water Once Stood
item.description: Curiosity has been exploring a region filled with boxwork formations, which formed billions of years ago when water leaked through rock cracks.

item.title: Treasury sanctions Russian zero-day broker accused of buying exploits stolen from U.S. defense contractor
item.description: The U.S. Treasury announced it was imposing sanctions against a Russian broker of zero-day exploits, its founder and two affiliates, citing a threat to U.S. national security. Another affiliated zero-day broker in the United Arab Emirates was also sanctioned.

item.title: Maul Kinda Regrets Wanting to Be Rid of the Jedi in ‘Shadow Lord’
item.description: The former Sith apprentice has a slight change of heart in the upcoming 'Star Wars' animated show.

item.title: Google adds a way to create automated workflows to Opal
item.description: Google is adding a new feature to Opal to create automated workflows

item.title: Pourquoi la nouvelle percée d’ASML change tout
item.description: Vous ne connaissez peut-être pas ASML, mais cette entreprise hollandaise possède les clés de votre vie numérique. En boostant la puissance de ses machines à 1 000 W, elle vient de s'assurer que nos futurs produits technologiques ne soient pas de simples luxes inaccessibles.

item.title: ‘Likely the Largest Breach in U.S. History’: What You Need to Know About the Conduent Fiasco
item.description: The known size of the breach keeps growing.

item.title: Spotify and Liquid Death release a limited-edition speaker shaped like… an urn?
item.description: Spotify and Liquid Death launched what might be the wildest product of the year: a speaker shaped like a urn.

item.title: Sony reveals the Death Stranding 2 required PC specs
item.description: We're less than a month from the availability of Death Stranding 2: On the Beach on PC, and today Sony released the required specs. Despite designer Hideo Kojima being known for spectacle in his projects, the minimum specs are quite reasonable. The low graphics preset runs on an NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1660 or AMD Radeon RX 5500 XT 8GB, and that will give players average performance of 1080p at 30 frames per second, which is rough but at least makes the game available for players who haven’t upgraded in awhile. Intel Core i3-10100 or AMD Ryzen 3 3100 are the recommended GPUs for that graphics tier....

item.title: 1Password is going up in price
item.description: 1Password is increasing its prices on March 27th, 2026. In an email sent to users, the password manager says it will raise the price of its yearly individual plan from $35.88 to $47.88, and that its family plan is going from $59.88 to $71.88. "While 1Password has grown substantially in value and capability, our pricing […]

item.title: Life in Cuba Under Trump's Pressure Campaign: No Electricity, No Oil, and Impossible Choices
item.description: As the United States takes new steps against the regime that has ruled the island since 1959, the Cuban people face 20-hour blackouts, decreased internet access, and shortages of basic supplies.

item.title: USB4 et 4 000 Mo/s : SanDisk muscle ses SSD malgré la crise du secteur
item.description: Vous avez sans doute un SSD SanDisk Extreme qui traîne dans votre sac photo. C'est la référence, malgré les polémiques récentes sur la fiabilité. La marque revient avec une version V3 qui double les débits grâce à l'USB4. Voici ce qu'il faut en retenir.

item.title: Someone made an app to warn you if smart glasses are nearby
item.description: A new app will notify users if smart glasses are likely nearby. The aptly named Nearby Glasses was developed in response to media coverage outlining how glasses like Meta's Ray-Bans have been used to film people without their consent. As first reported by 404 Media, the app detects the unique Bluetooth signature emitted by smart glasses and sends a push alert that someone wearing the device may potentially be nearby. “I consider it to be a tiny part of resistance against surveillance tech,” the app's developer Yves Jeanrenaud told 404 Media. Smart glasses have sparked increased privacy concern...

item.title: YouTube’s Most Maximal Synth Sorcerer to Represent the UK at Eurovision
item.description: It's time for the tinkerers to take over one of the world's biggest stages.

item.title: Seedance 2.0 might be gen AI video’s next big hope, but it’s still slop
item.description: When Irish filmmaker Ruairi Robinson began uploading a series of short clips created with Seedance 2.0 - TikTok developer ByteDance's newest video generation model - it was hard to deny that the footage was much more impressive than what we've seen from other gen AI outfits. The clips' star (a digital duplicate of Tom Cruise) […]

item.title: Warner Bros. is reviewing a new offer from Paramount as the takeover fight heats up
item.description: Paramount was widely expected to have raised its offer, but new details on the bid were not disclosed. Warner Bros. Discovery says it’s reviewing a new takeover offer from Paramount, but it continues to recommend a competing proposal from Netflix to its shareholders in the meantime.

item.title: Cette marque de smartphones risque de disparaître
item.description: En 2012, Meizu était un fabricant de smartphones très prometteur. Aujourd'hui, la marque ne serait plus qu'un simple département logiciel au sein de l'empire Geely. Les rumeurs de dissolution de l'équipe mobile confirment une fin de parcours inévitable pour un pionnier qui a perdu son âme.

item.title: 'If organizations focus only on short-term efficiency... they risk hollowing out the next generation of technical leaders': Microsoft execs say senior workers must mentor juniors to fix AI mistakes
item.description: AI promises huge productivity gains, but we still need future generations of human workers to work alongside it, Microsoft execs say.

item.title: Why your best-looking candidates often perform the worst
item.description: Research shows top performers can be eight times more productive—yet most hiring systems are designed to filter them out.

item.title: iPhone Fold rumors: Everything we know right now, including the leaked design, upgrades, price and more
item.description: Apple still hasn’t revealed a foldable iPhone, but the steady drip of leaks suggests the project is moving closer to reality. Over the past few months, analysts and supply-chain watchers have continued to fill in key details, with most reports still pointing to a launch sometime in the second half of 2026. While Apple hasn’t confirmed anything publicly, the overall picture is starting to look more consistent.As always, plans for unreleased Apple hardware can change at any time. Features may shift, timelines can slip and some prototypes may never ship. Even so, recent reporting gives us the cle...

item.title: Comment Claude Code a provoqué la chute d’IBM
item.description: L'action IBM vient de dévisser de 13 % en une seule séance. C'est sa pire chute depuis l'an 2000. La cause ? Pas une erreur de gestion, mais une nouvelle fonction de l'IA Claude qui s'attaque au cœur du business des banques : le vieux code COBOL.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says these ‘dumb things’ in our current economy could point to another financial crisis
item.description: At JP Morgan Chase’s investor day, CEO Dimon warned we’re seeing the same signs that preceded 2008’s Great Recession. Jamie Dimon, the CEO of JPMorgan Chase, is sounding the alarm bell, warning investors that he is starting to see some similarities between today’s financial landscape and the lead-up to the 2008 financial crisis, nearly 20 years ago....

item.title: Votre PC est-il prêt pour Crimson Desert ? Voici les composants nécessaires
item.description: Attendu depuis de longues années, Crimson Desert va enfin pointer le bout de son nez et vous permettre d'explorer un immense monde ouvert. Que faudra-t-il pour y jouer sur PC ou Mac ?

item.title: Test de la Reolink E1 Pro : une caméra abordable, motorisée et efficace qui ne vous lâche pas du regard
item.description: Les caméras de surveillance intérieures avec suivi de mouvement ne sont plus rares, à 80, voire moins de 60 euros. Toutefois, elles ne sont pas toutes efficientes et manquent souvent d’intelligence, autant de points sur lesquels la Reolink E1 Pro promet des prestations de haut niveau. Ce que nous nous sommes empressés de vérifier…

item.title: Meta investit 100 milliards de dollars dans AMD pour concurrencer Nvidia
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg vient de sortir le carnet de chèques, et ce n'est pas pour s'offrir un nouveau réseau social. Meta vient de sceller un accord de 100 milliards de dollars avec AMD. L'objectif ? Sécuriser des puces IA MI450 et, au passage, devenir l'un des plus gros actionnaires.

item.title: We’re Getting Major ‘House of Leaves’ Vibes From This Creepy New Trailer
item.description: 'Backrooms,' based on a popular YouTube series, is in theaters this summer with a star-studded cast.

item.title: You can still get $30 in Samsung credit when you reserve a Galaxy S26 phone
item.description: Samsung is set to introduce its new Galaxy S26 lineup at its next Unpacked event on February 25th, potentially alongside a new pair of earbuds and other wearables. If you’re thinking about picking up any of the new devices, it’s worth claiming Samsung’s $30 promotional credit before it expires, which you can do by registering your […]

item.title: Twitch is overhauling its suspensions policy
item.description: The company is implementing two suspension types: streaming suspensions and chatting suspensions.

item.title: Pokémon Day sales are already kicking off at Argos — save 24% off Pokémon Legends Z-A Nintendo Switch 2 Edition
item.description: Pokémon games and merch are enjoying big discounts at Argos ahead of Pokémon Day.

item.title: Colonies lunaires : l’Italie explore une voie énergétique inattendue
item.description: Dans un contexte favorable à l’exploration humaine de la Lune et à son utilisation, l'Italie se positionne comme un acteur clé en dévoilant son projet ambitieux dédié à l'énergie nucléaire sur la Lune. Ce tournant vers l'énergie nucléaire, plutôt que l’utilisation de l’énergie solaire, pourrait...

item.title: Marvel's Wolverine will hit PS5 on September 15
item.description: As spicy as the PlayStation State of Play that took place a couple of weeks ago was overall, there was one major first-party game that was notably absent from the showcase: Marvel’s Wolverine. Insomniac Games’ latest superhero blockbuster was already slated for a fall release and now the studio has revealed exactly when you’ll be able to get your claws on it. Marvel’s Wolverine is coming to PS5 on September 15.That’s it. That’s the announcement. There’s no new trailer to accompany the news, other than a six-second release date reveal video that popped up on YouTube. Insomniac previously said i...

item.title: Google ajoute deux fonctions très attendues dans YouTube Premium Lite, sans frais supplémentaires
item.description: Google améliore la formule YouTube Premium Lite en y ajoutant deux fonctions très intéressantes : la lecture en arrière-plan et le téléchargement de vidéos. Des nouveautés qui enrichissent une offre qui permettait déjà de regarder le contenu de la plateforme (hors musique) sans pub.

item.title: For All Mankind's latest trailer teases a war on Mars
item.description: Apple just dropped a full trailer for the fifth season of its hit sci-fi show For All Mankind. This is the first real look at the upcoming batch of episodes, which premiere on March 27. We got an extremely short teaser trailer last month but that only showed a guy on a motorcycle riding across Mars. This is the first real-deal trailer and it's absolutely stuffed with footage indicating where the next season will take viewers. I'm going to get into some spoilers here, so read at your own risk. For the uninitiated, For All Mankind is an alternate history show that started with a simple premise. ...

item.title: iOS 26.4 beta 2: Everything new, how to try it now
item.description: Here's what's new with iOS 26.4 beta 2.

item.title: OpenAI COO says ‘we have not yet really seen AI penetrate enterprise business processes’
item.description: Earlier this month, OpenAI launched a new platform called OpenAI Frontier for enterprises to build and manage agents, but OpenAI COO Brad Lightcap said that businesses haven’t yet seen AI adoption at scale. “One of the interesting things and some of the inspiration for the work we’ve been doing lately around OpenAI Frontier is we […]

item.title: How to watch Lost Women of Alaska — stream chilling true-crime investigation
item.description: Dive into a chilling true-crime investigation docuseries. Here’s how to watch Lost Women of Alaska online from anywhere.

item.title: Meet the Gigamaser—the Brightest Microwave Laser Ever Spotted in Deep Space
item.description: A lucky alignment of galaxies allowed researchers to identify the most powerful and distant "space laser" ever found.

item.title: Anthropic’s Claude Comes for Knowledge Work as Markets Freak Out
item.description: Claude Cowork's industry-specific plug-in freaked out investors. Now, there is more.

item.title: Reddit fined $19.6 million over age verification checks in the UK
item.description: A common theme in online age verification laws is the tension between user privacy and preventing children from accessing harmful or inappropriate content. Now the UK is sending a not-so-subtle message to Reddit on the subject, to the tune of £14.5m ($19.6 million). The nation's Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) accused the company of using children’s data and potentially exposing them to inappropriate content.“Children under 13 had their personal information collected and used in ways they could not understand, consent to or control,” UK Information Commissioner John Edwards wrote in a...

item.title: One of the Limited Edition DualSense controllers I covet the most has had its price slashed at PlayStation Direct
item.description: Even though I have loads of PS5 controllers already, I can't help but want this limited edition variant — which is reduced at PS Direct right now.

item.title: Avec cette remise de 30 %, le Sony Inzone H9 II gomme un de ses principaux défauts
item.description: Critiqué à sa sortie pour son manque d'autonomie et son prix assez important, le Sony Inzone H9 II profite de cette remise de cent euros sur Amazon pour corriger ce dernier défaut.

item.title: A suspension part Ford stopped using in 2019 is now triggering a massive recall
item.description: Ford is recalling 412,774 Explorer SUVs after a rear suspension part was found to potentially fracture and affect steering control. Ford is recalling nearly 413,000 Explorer SUVs in the U.S. The recall comes after federal regulators warned that a faulty rear suspension component called a “toe link” could restrict a driver’s steering control.

item.title: Stripe’s valuation soars 74% to $159 billion
item.description: Stripe has conducted another tender offer, where employees sell shares. Investors include Thrive Capital, Coatue, a16z, and Stripe itself

item.title: PlayStation’s Wolverine game hits PS5 in September
item.description: Marvel's Wolverine, the next superhero game from Marvel's Spider-Man developer Insomniac Games, will be released on PS5 on September 15th. Insomniac announced that it would be making a Wolverine game way back in 2021, so it's been a long wait in the leadup to an official release date. Sony gave a vague fall 2026 release […]

item.title: Read Jony Ive’s advice to young creatives
item.description: Two new books, freely released by the Steve Jobs Archive, feature invaluable advice to aspiring minds. In this exclusive excerpt, we hear from Jony Ive. The advice you get early in your career can disproportionately shape your future. I can recall two or three conversations from when I was a college kid who liked writing that melted away ambiguity and set my vague ambitions on a path into the fog like a compass. ...

item.title: Capcom was initially 'skeptical' about Resident Evil Requiem running well on the Nintendo Switch 2, but was pleasantly surprised, says director — 'With specs like these in handheld mode, it looks great'
item.description: Resident Evil Requiem director Koshi Nakanishi has revealed that Capcom was initially "skeptical" about the game's Nintendo Switch 2 performance, but was pleasantly surprised.

item.title: Archer Aviation accuses rival Vertical Aerospace of ripping off its air taxi designs
item.description: Look at the two air taxi designs above. Look similar? The company that designed the one on the left sure thinks so, which is why it's accusing the firm that designed the one on the right of patent infringement. On Monday, Archer Aviation filed a complaint in the US District Court Eastern District of Texas […]

item.title: ‘This should terrify you’: Meta Superintelligence safety director lost control of her AI agent—it deleted her emails
item.description: OpenClaw nearly wiped out the AI alignment employee’s entire inbox, in an incident that social media is calling ironic. As built-in AI pops up in more aspects of everyday life, laymen are counting on the experts to keep technology safe to use. But one Meta employee’s misadventure with AI has social media users fearful for the future of AI alignment....
